meanings.definition: Capable of sinning or making mistakes.
meanings.sent1: Even the most peccable individuals can learn from their mistakes.
meanings.sent2: It is human nature to be peccable and learn from our errors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat showed its peccable side by knocking over the vase.
meanings.sent4: Her peccable actions painted a picture of imperfection in an otherwise flawless plan.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's peccable behavior served as a reminder that everyone is fallible.
